intro: Acinodendron asclepiadeum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a small to medium-sized shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its latex contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. The plant is often used in traditional medicine, though its use is limited due to its toxic properties.
